ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We will call the Guards of Hell!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We shall call the guards of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We too shall summon the guards of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and We too will call the stern and angry keepers of hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We will now call the guards!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: We will call out the guards of Hell!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: We too would summon the braves of the army.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We shall call on the guards of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: We will call the guards of hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We shall summon the guards of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: We also shall call the infernal guards.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: We [too] shall call the keepers of hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: We will call on the angels of punishment (to deal with him)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: We will call the guards of Hell (to deal with him)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We, will call the Zabania (the harsh angels of Hell).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: We will call the angels of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [96:18] We shall call the Zabāniya, the grim stern angels to destroy him, as [stated] in the hadīth, ‘Had he called his council [of henchmen] together, the Zabāniya would have seized him right before his own eyes!’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (We will call the guards of hell) i.e. the keepers of hell.
